item.title: Wendy's Replacing Workers With Kiosks In Response to 'Fight For $15'
item.description:
Wendy's Replacing Workers With Kiosks In Response to 'Fight For $15'

The fast food chain announced it will start automating all of its restaurants by installing self-serve kiosks in 6,000 locations by the end of the year. Although McDonalds has already been experimenting with kiosks, Wendy's announcement is the largest roll-out to date and will likely spark a trend leading to fully robotic restaurants.

item.title: Can one product really contain everything the body needs? - disinformation
item.description:
Can one product really contain everything the body needs? - disinformation

Powdered plant based foods claiming to contain everything the body needs are hitting the market, and if the companies behind them have their way you'll soon be mixing up your nutritionally compete matrix style gruel for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

item.title: House Hides Most War Funding in NDAA Bill Scheme
item.description:
House Hides Most War Funding in NDAA Bill Scheme

May 11, 2016   |   admintam The House Appropriations Committee has today unveiled its draft version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA), a $575 billion bill that includes some $59 billion worth of money for Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO), the controversial fund which the Pentagon is allowed to shuffle around.

item.title: The Kepler Mission Has Found Another 1,284 Planets-The Biggest Haul Yet
item.description:
The Kepler Mission Has Found Another 1,284 Planets-The Biggest Haul Yet

NASA's Kepler space telescope, which has been taking a galactic census, just verified a whopping 1,284 new planets-the most ever announced in one go, scientists said on Tuesday. This planetary bounty more than doubles the number of confirmed planets that Kepler has already found, and some of them are thought to be Earthlike.

item.title: Here's What Happens to A Kid's Body After Cutting Sugar for Just 10 Days
item.description:
Here's What Happens to A Kid's Body After Cutting Sugar for Just 10 Days

May 7, 2016   |   admintam (NATURALSOCIETY) Although it may sound like a bad infomercial, a study financed by the National Institutes of Health has shown that cutting added sugar in children's diets can improve their overall health incredibly quickly.

item.title: YACHT's Sex Tape Hoax Took Advantage of People's Empathy for Revenge Porn Victims | NOISEY
item.description:
YACHT's Sex Tape Hoax Took Advantage of People's Empathy for Revenge Porn Victims | NOISEY

UPDATE: YACHT have apologized and issued a statement on the situation. Read it here. Never blame the victim. That's the mentality the social media age has attempted to foster on cases of abuse and sexual assault. And on the surface, it's a good one.

item.title: The Verge summer movie guide: blockbusters, comedies, and brand experiments
item.description:
The Verge summer movie guide: blockbusters, comedies, and brand experiments

The biggest explosions and hugs of the season Summer 2016 is upon us, and with it comes some of the year's biggest movies. As always, the hottest months of the year bring some of the biggest Hollywood blockbusters and friendliest family fare any moviegoer is ready to spend their hard-earned cash on.

item.title: FDA sued over approval of genetically engineered 'frankenfish'
item.description:
FDA sued over approval of genetically engineered 'frankenfish'

The US Food and Drug Administration is being sued by a coalition of environmental, fishing and consumer groups for its approval of genetically engineered salmon - the first such animal to ever be sold for commercial consumption. The lawsuit announced Thursday challenges the FDA's power to approve the salmon, which can be grown twice as quickly as natural salmon.

item.title: A Start-up Has Invented Veggie Burgers That 'Bleed'
item.description:
A Start-up Has Invented Veggie Burgers That 'Bleed'

A biochemist named Patrick Brown has come up with yet another alternative strategy to produce entirely meatless hamburgers that look and taste very much like meat. That's one above, looking sufficiently burgerlike; it's even got that pristine medium-rare thing going on.

item.title: The War on Vaping - disinformation
item.description:
The War on Vaping - disinformation

( ANTIMEDIA) As people have taken up vaping in droves, it was only a matter of time before the joy police pulled up and slapped rules on the electronic substitute. This week, the Food and Drug Administration did exactly that when it announced U.S. tobacco regulations will be extended to e-cigarettes.
